circumstances: On final approach to Laredo Airport runway 32 by night, the pilot failed to realize his altitude was too low when the airplane struck the ground and crashed three miles southeast of the airport. The airplane was destroyed and both occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Controlled collision with ground due to improper IFR operation. The following contributing factors were reported: 
- Low ceiling, 
- Fog,
- Visibility one mile or less, 
- Weather conditions below minimums.
